characters.name: Ogilvy
characters.description: A well-known astronomer who was excited about the news of the Martian activity.

characters.name: Lavelle of Java
characters.description: An astronomer who reported the outbreak of incandescent gas on Mars.

characters.name: Perrotin of Nice
characters.description: An observer who saw the great light on Mars.

characters.name: Markham
characters.description: An editor who was jubilant about securing a new photograph of Mars.

characters.name: Narrator's wife
characters.description: The narrator's wife who accompanied him on a walk.

characters.name: Schiaparelli
characters.description: An astronomer who watched the red planet.

characters.name: Albin
characters.description: Described the falling star as leaving a greenish streak.

characters.name: Denning
characters.description: Greatest authority on meteorites.

characters.name: Henderson
characters.description: London journalist who was informed by Ogilvy.

characters.name: Stent
characters.description: Astronomer Royal giving directions at the pit.

characters.name: Lord Hilton
characters.description: Lord of the manor, expected to help with crowd control.

characters.name: Narrator
characters.description: The person recounting the events.

characters.name: The boy
characters.description: A boy who runs towards the narrator, expressing fear about the cylinder.

characters.name: The shopman
characters.description: A young man, a shop assistant, who falls into the pit.

characters.name: The woman
characters.description: A woman who shrieks in fear at the sight of the Martians.

characters.name: The narrator
characters.description: The person recounting the events, experiencing fear and curiosity.

characters.name: The neighbour
characters.description: A man who is a neighbour of the narrator, expressing horror at the Martians.

characters.name: Mounted policeman
characters.description: A policeman who came galloping through the confusion, screaming.

characters.name: Woman over the gate
characters.description: A woman who was part of a group at the gate, skeptical about the Martians.

characters.name: Two men at the gate
characters.description: Two men who were part of a group at the gate, skeptical about the Martians.

characters.name: Workman
characters.description: A workman carrying a basket, who passed the narrator.

characters.name: Little boy with the workman
characters.description: A little boy accompanying the workman.

characters.name: Major Eden
characters.description: An officer reported to be missing.

characters.name: The colonel
characters.description: The colonel of the regiment who was questioning the crowd at midnight.

characters.name: Milkman
characters.description: A person who delivers milk and provides news about the Martians.

characters.name: Neighbour
characters.description: The narrator's neighbor who discusses the Martians and offers strawberries.

characters.name: Marshall
characters.description: A tobacconist whose son was among the dead on the common.

characters.name: Marshall's son
characters.description: Mentioned as being among the dead on the common.

characters.name: Landlord
characters.description: The owner of the Spotted Dog, who rents out a horse and dog cart.

characters.name: Servant
characters.description: The narrator's servant, who is evacuated with the narrator's wife.

characters.name: Doctor
characters.description: Mentioned as having a cart ahead of the narrator.

characters.name: Narrator's Wife
characters.description: The narrator's wife, who is silent and seems oppressed with forebodings of evil.

characters.name: Cousins
characters.description: The narrator's relatives in Leatherhead, who take care of the narrator's wife.

characters.name: Cousins' Man
characters.description: The man who lights the lamps for the narrator's journey back.

characters.name: Landlord of the Spotted Dog
characters.description: The landlord whose conveyance the narrator had taken, found dead by the narrator.

characters.name: Soldier
characters.description: A soldier who recounts his experience with the Martian invasion to the narrator.

characters.name: Martians
characters.description: Alien invaders operating large mechanical machines.

characters.name: The Narrator
characters.description: The person recounting the events, planning to take his wife to safety.

characters.name: The Artilleryman
characters.description: A soldier who plans to rejoin his battery and accompanies the narrator.

characters.name: The Narrator's Wife
characters.description: The narrator's wife, whom he plans to take to Newhaven.

characters.name: The Lieutenant
characters.description: A cavalry officer of the 8th Hussars encountered by the narrator and the artilleryman.

characters.name: Brigadier-General Marvin
characters.description: A military officer stationed at Weybridge.

characters.name: The Vicar
characters.description: A religious figure holding a service amidst the chaos.

characters.name: The Shrivelled Old Fellow
characters.description: An old man arguing with a soldier about his valuable orchids.

characters.name: The Corporal
characters.description: A soldier trying to convince people to leave their belongings.

characters.name: The Woman Beside the Narrator
characters.description: A woman expressing doubt about the soldiers' ability to stop the Martians.

characters.name: The Man in a Blue Jersey
characters.description: A man who shouts upon seeing the Martians.

characters.name: The Martians
characters.description: Alien invaders with advanced technology, including Heat-Rays.

characters.name: A man in black
characters.description: A man the narrator pushes aside while trying to see around the bend.

characters.name: The Curate
characters.description: A religious figure who is struggling to comprehend the destruction caused by the Martians.

characters.name: My brother
characters.description: The narrator's brother, who experiences the events in London.

characters.name: The man who lodged across the landing
characters.description: A man living in the same building as my brother, who is curious about the commotion.

characters.name: Policeman
characters.description: A policeman warning people about the Martians.

characters.name: His landlady
characters.description: The woman who owns or manages the lodging where my brother stays.

characters.name: Her husband
characters.description: The husband of my brother's landlady.

characters.name: Newsvendor
characters.description: A man selling newspapers during the panic.

characters.name: Miss Elphinstone
characters.description: A woman who is with my brother and shows courage during the events.

characters.name: Ellen
characters.description: A little girl who is frightened and looking for her mother.

characters.name: Ellen's mother
characters.description: A woman in the crowd calling for her daughter Ellen.

characters.name: Lord Garrick
characters.description: A man who is dying and very thirsty, identified as the Chief Justice.

characters.name: A little old man
characters.description: An old man with a grey military moustache and a filthy black frock coat.

characters.name: A man on horseback
characters.description: A man who warns others that 'they are coming'.

characters.name: A coachman
characters.description: A coachman who is driving a carriage.

characters.name: A bearded, eagle-faced man
characters.description: A man carrying a small handbag filled with sovereigns.

characters.name: Miss Elphinstone's sister-in-law
characters.description: A woman who is with Miss Elphinstone and my brother, weeping and too wretched to call upon 'George'.

characters.name: George
characters.description: Referenced by Miss Elphinstone's sister-in-law, but not directly present.

characters.name: The captain
characters.description: The captain of the steamer who is actively involved in the events.

characters.name: Martian
characters.description: An alien being involved in the conflict.

characters.name: Curate
characters.description: A religious figure accompanying the narrator, often in despair.

characters.name: Narrator's Cousin
characters.description: Described as brave but not quick to realize danger.

characters.name: Artilleryman
characters.description: Mentioned as having taught the narrator something.

characters.name: The Stout, Ruddy, Middle-aged Man
characters.description: A man captured by the Martians, described as well-dressed and of considerable consequence.

characters.name: The Lad
characters.description: A young male who is killed by the Martians.

characters.name: Sheen
characters.description: A location expected to be in ruins.

characters.name: Roehampton
characters.description: A location near which the narrator finds skeletons.

characters.name: Putney
characters.description: A location affected by the Martian invasion.

characters.name: Richmond
characters.description: A location where the Thames is affected by the red weed.

characters.name: Hampton
characters.description: A location affected by the spread of the red weed.

characters.name: Twickenham
characters.description: A location affected by the spread of the red weed.

characters.name: Berlin
characters.description: A city speculated to be under Martian attack.

characters.name: Paris
characters.description: A city speculated to be under Martian attack.

characters.name: Thomas Lobb
characters.description: A greengrocer from New Malden, mentioned in passing.

characters.name: artilleryman
characters.description: A man the narrator parted from at the beginning of the text.

characters.name: man lying at the corner of the lane
characters.description: A man found by the narrator, covered in black dust and drunk.

characters.name: tattered woman
characters.description: A dead woman found on a doorstep with a gashed hand.

characters.name: Martian giant
characters.description: A Martian machine emitting a howling sound.

characters.name: narrator
characters.description: The person recounting the events in the text.

characters.name: Carver
characters.description: Person who made suggestions about the rapid death of the Martians.

characters.name: Lessing
characters.description: Person who advanced reasons for the Martians landing on Venus.
